intro: Crotalaria mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and compound leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, and the plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Crotalaria mexicana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
